item.title: Frank add a quote by John Paul II
item.description: "Freedom consists not in doing what we like, but in having the right to do what we <i>ought.</i>" -- John Paul II

item.title: Frank add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Frank add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Frank add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Frank add a quote by John Raulston Saul
item.description: "I have a theory of statistics: if you can double them or halve them and they still work, they are really good statistics." -- John Raulston Saul

item.title: Frank add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Frank add a quote by Yevgeny Yevtushenko
item.description: "Be equal to your talent, not your age. At times let the gap between them be embarrassing." -- Yevgeny Yevtushenko

item.title: Frank add a quote by Studs Terkel
item.description: "Work is about a search for daily meaning as well as daily bread, for recognition as well as cash, for astonishment rather than torpor; in short, for a sort of life rather than a Monday through Friday sort of dying." -- Studs Terkel
